title: European Union strikes landmark deal on AI regulation
summary: EU negotiators reached a deal Friday on the world's first comprehensive artificial intelligence rules, paving the way for legal oversight of technology used in popular generative AI services like ChatGPT.

title: Israel documents sexual violence committed during Hamas attack
summary: Since October 7, women have stepped forward to share their stories, but the chaotic nature of the massacre makes the investigation of sexual crimes difficult.

title: The US vetoes UN Security Council resolution calling for immediate ceasefire in Gaza
summary: Friday's resolution, supported by nearly all Security Council members and many other nations, urged an instant cease-fire in Gaza, where Palestinian civilians are enduring what the UN chief describes as a 'humanitarian nightmare.'

title: Putin running in the 2024 Russian election as protector of the nation against the West
summary: The 71-year-old Russian president declared his candidacy on Friday for the presidential election to be held on March 17, 2024.

title: Six French teenagers convicted for their roles in 2020 beheading of teacher
summary: A French juvenile court handed suspended sentences to six teenagers for their involvement in the killing of Samuel Paty by an Islamist extremist after he showed caricatures of Muhammad to his class for a debate on freedom of expression.

title: Pledging 'retribution,' Trump fuels fears for rule of law
summary: The former president, the favorite for the Republican nomination, is putting forward his proposals for a second term. But even some of his fellow conservatives are worried about his vengeful rhetoric.

title: Hanukkah ceremony at Elysée sparks secularism backlash against Macron
summary: After the chief rabbi of France lit a Hannukah candle in Emmanuel Macron's company at the presidential palace, all the opposition parties have criticized a breach of French secularism, as has the head of the Representative Council of French Jewish Institutions.

title: Israel forces Gazans into new exodus toward Rafah: 'Where do they want us to move to?'
summary: With makeshift shelters erected not far from the Egyptian border, most of those fleeing have already been displaced several times since the start of the war.

title: Le Pen, her party and 26 others will be tried over fake European Parliament jobs
summary: Marine Le Pen and her party are charged with embezzlement of public funds and collusion, accused of using EU funds to pay for party staff. The trial is scheduled to take place from March to November 2024.

title: One in six Swiss MPs is a farmer
summary: There may be fewer and fewer farmers in the country, but they are now the best-represented profession in the new Swiss parliament.

title: Macron invites pope to Notre-Dame reopening, announces creation of museum
summary: President Emmanuel Macron visited the Parisian cathedral, one year ahead of its scheduled reopening. He said a museum would be opened to mark its reconstruction after the 2019 blaze.

title: Macron asks to transform the way research is organized in France
summary: Emmanuel Macron announced the creation of a 'presidential council' to advise him on the progress of science, and has given research organizations and universities 18 months to 'restore clarity' in the war France's scientific community is organized.

title: US approves breakthrough sickle cell therapy that uses gene-editing tool
summary: US regulators on Friday approved two gene therapies for sickle cell disease that doctors hope can cure the painful, inherited blood disorder that afflicts mostly Black people in the US.

title: Putin announces he will run for fifth term in 2024 presidential election
summary: Vladimir Putin, 71, has led Russia since the turn of the century, winning four presidential terms with an interlude as prime minister. Unlikely to be seriously challenged, Putin could stay in power until at least 2036, following his 2020 constitutional reform.

title: Spanish economy minister to head European Investment Bank
summary: Nadia Calvino beat out EU Commissioner Margarethe Vestager to head the world's biggest multilateral public lender, whose decisions form the crux of several major EU debates, including funding war-torn Ukraine, the green transition and nuclear power.

title: Egypt: Ahead of the presidential election, the war in Gaza overshadows el-Sissi's record
summary: Presenting himself as the 'key mediator' in the conflict, President Abdel Fattah el-Sissi, confident of his victory, is trying to brush up his position on the international stage.

title: Turkey and Greece open 'new, calmer chapter' in tumultuous relationship
summary: The Turkish president, visiting Athens for the first time in seven years, signed a 'declaration of friendship and good-neighborly relations' with the Greek prime minister, testifying to their desire to ease the heightened tensions of recent years.

title: What is the Martel Division, the neonazi group banned by the French government?
summary: This radical far-right group, founded in 2022, was dissolved by the Council of Ministers on December 6. It had planned violent actions against people of North African descent, and several of its militants were involved in recent street clashes.

title: Ryan O'Neal, star of 'Love Story' and 'Barry Lyndon', dies at 82
summary: The actor who rose from a TV soap opera to earn an Oscar nomination for 'Love Story' and showcased a charming performance alongside his 9-year-old daughter Tatum in 'Paper Moon,' passed away on Friday.

title: US teenager sentenced to life in prison for school shooting
summary: On Friday, a judge handed a life sentence to a Michigan teenager, aged 15 at the time of the attack, for the murder of four students.

title: China welcomes Taliban ambassador without recognizing the Afghan regime
summary: Beijing, which exploits a very large copper deposit in Afghanistan and shares a 47-mile border with the country, seeks to stabilize relations with the nation.

title: 'Julstress': Swedish parents' Christmas preparation anxiety
summary: In Sweden, some people prepare weeks in advance to make sure they're ready when the festivities kick off in early December.

title: Is celebrating Hanukkah at the Elysée a breach of France's secularism?
summary: A video showing Chief Rabbi of France Haïm Korsia lighting a candle in the Elysée reception hall alongside President Emmanuel Macron sparked a heated debate on 'laïcité.'

title: Guatemala: Presidential election results upheld by electoral court amid coup accusations
summary: Guatemalan prosecutors on Friday said investigations concluded that the elections won by Bernardo Arevalo were 'null and void', citing counting 'anomalies'. This action was labeled by the Organization of American States as an 'attempted coup.'

title: After the killing of a teenager, a chasm opened in a French town
summary: The deeply divided town of Romans-sur-Isère is reeling from the death of a 16-year-old at a party in a neighboring village, which sparked a national debate. In the deprived Monnaie neighborhood, fractures have only gotten wider in the aftermath.

title: Joe Biden tackles 'junk fees,' the hidden charges plaguing American consumers
summary: The US President is pushing for transparent pricing and protection against these fees, which are found everywhere from airlines to hotels and taxis.

title: COP28: Climate talks heat up after OPEC push on fossil fuels
summary: OPEC Secretary General Haitham Al Ghais sent a letter to the group's 13 members and 10 Russian-led allies this week after negotiators at climate talks in Dubai released a draft deal that included calls for a phase-out of fossil fuels.
